I.	ARTICLE 6 § 1 OF THE CONVENTION ("reasonable time")
Starting-point: impossible to go back further than 1 August 1973, when Italy's declaration recognising right of individual petition took effect, but regard to be had to state of case at that time.
Close: filing of Court of Appeal's judgment.
Reasonableness of length of proceedings: to be assessed in light of particular circumstances of case, which in this instance called for an overall assessment.
Measures taken by national courts had not made full reparation for the consequences of the breach found.
Conclusion: respondent State to pay a specified sum in compensation (unanimously).
